message: I’m especially grateful today for the hard work of our Intelligence Community and Armed Forces. On September 11, 2001, our nation was attacked by extremists who sought to strike fear into the the heart of America and free people across the world.  We owe a tremendous debt of gratitude to the brave men and women who put their lives on the line and brought the fight to the terrorists and those who harbor them. Every day, our bravest work to ensure that such a heinous crime will never happen again, and rest assured, we will #NeverForget.

I’m very excited by this promising blueprint for reforming our broken tax code in the Senate. This bill will update and simplify our incredibly complex tax system so that every-day, middle-class Americans can keep more of their hard-earned dollars. For instance, the typical family of four making the median family income will save nearly $1,500. The standard deduction also nearly doubles for individuals and families, and the child tax credit is significantly expanded. By bringing money back from overseas and encouraging entrepreneurship and small business again, we will finally be able to unleash our economy and get the country back on track. I look forward to working with my colleagues in the Senate Finance Committee, as well as the House Ways and Means Committee, to put together a bill through an open process that will bring much-needed relief to millions of Americans.
Today is the first day of the 115th Congress. I am humbled and excited to represent the people of North Carolina for a third term.   You can watch the swearing in ceremony live on C-SPAN at NOON.
Proud to introduce my granddaughter to Vice President Joe Biden at my swearing in ceremony today.
My granddaughter warmed hearts when she stole the show at the Senate swearing-in ceremony yesterday.
There is snow in the forecast, but it is never too cold to drive the Thing ❄️☃️ #NoRoofNoProblem #LongLiveTheThing
The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence will hold an open hearing on Tuesday on Russian intelligence activities.
Communities across the state are expected to experience winter weather this weekend. Avoid driving if conditions are icy. Stay safe, stay home.

I’m leading an open Intelligence Committee hearing on Russian Intelligence Activities at 1PM today. Intelligence Community leaders including  Director of National Intelligence James Clapper, CIA Director John Brennan, NSA Director Admiral Michael Rogers, and FBI Director James Comey will testify.  Check back at 1PM today to watch it LIVE.

LIVE: Senate Intelligence Committee Open Hearing on Russian Intelligence Activities  Witnesses:  James Clapper, Director of National Intelligence John Brennan, Director, Central Intelligence Agency Admiral Michael Rogers, Director, National Security Agency James Comey, Director, Federal Bureau of Investigation
NA
Tomorrow morning, the Senate Intelligence Committee will consider the nomination of Congressman Mike Pompeo to be Director of the CIA. You can watch the hearing LIVE right here on Facebook.
LIVE Intelligence Committee Hearing for Congressman Mike Pompeo to be Director of the CIA
LIVE Intelligence Committee Hearing for Congressman Mike Pompeo to be Director of the CIA

It’s about time, these veterans put their lives on the line for our nation and they were negligently poisoned by the government. We know that toxic water at Lejeune caused a host of debilitating medical conditions that service members are suffering and dying from. These men and women deserve this help.
Today, we honor the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King.
I’m looking forward to questioning Education Secretary nominee Betsy DeVos tonight. Check back at 5PM today to watch her confirmation hearing live right here on Facebook.

The U.S. Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee Republicans is considering the nomination of Betsy DeVos to be Secretary of Education. I plan to ask several questions and I welcome your suggestions.
The U.S. Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee Republicans is considering the nomination of Rep. Tom Price to Serve as Secretary of Health and Human Services.

I’m glad that we had a lively discussion with Betsy DeVos about her vision for the Department of Education. Her commitment to improving education and expanding opportunity for our students is unmatched. Betsy DeVos is the person we need for this job and I am proud to support her nomination.
The Senate Committee on Finance is considering the nomination of Steve Mnuchin to be Secretary of the Treasury.

Cleaning up the mess at the IRS is one of my top priorities. I’m glad Treasury Secretary nominee Steven Mnuchin is committed to my plan to stop the IRS from rewarding employees that don’t pay their personal taxes.
I joined Martha MacCallum live from the National Mall tonight to talk about the presidential transition and the intelligence community.
The peaceful transition of power is one of America's greatest traditions. Congratulations POTUS #Inauguration
Thank you President Trump for taking steps to give Americans relief from the harmful damage of Obamacare as Congress works to repeal and replace.
Congressman Mike Pompeo is an excellent choice to lead the CIA. I will vote to confirm his nomination this evening.

Today, the Senate voted overwhelmingly to confirm Rep. Mike Pompeo to be the next Director of the Central Intelligence Agency. While I’m disappointed Senate democrats insisted on delaying his vote, I’m pleased he is in place and ready to help keep our country safe.  He is well equipped to handle the demands of CIA Director. I know he will ensure that the CIA is well positioned to reinforce our national security in the coming years.
North Carolinians deserve better than Obamacare’s broken promises. HHS nominee Tom Price is committed to fixing health care.

Childcare tax credits work. This is an issue that I’ve been working on with Senator Angus S. King, Jr. for years, and I will continue to push for commonsense solutions that saves American families money. President Trump has prioritized making childcare more affordable through the tax code, so we feel strongly that the PACE Act should be on the table as a way to help working families afford the safe child care they need.

Nikki Haley will bring a fresh perspective to the United Nations. She has a record of success in South Carolina and is well prepared to engage with world leaders and craft solutions to the world’s most difficult humanitarian crises and political conflicts. Her pledge to support Israel, our closest ally in the region, will rebuild a critical relationship

This is an important day for the families of children with disabilities. ABLE accounts are a game changer for people living with disabilities. Now families will be able to save to give their children a better future. The ABLE program is an example of what is working in Washington, what we can accomplish when we work together on programs that improve people’s lives.

Camp Lejeune veterans eligible to receive disability compensation under the recently published VA regulation will not be affected by President Trump’s recent executive order banning new regulations. The White House has granted an exemption. This means the Camp Lejeune regulation will go in effect on March 14, 2017, as scheduled.
NA

Check out my constituent newsletter for an update on the confirmation process. You can sign up to receive the newsletter on my website.  https://www.burr.senate.gov/contact/newsletter   The 115th Congress is off to a productive start. Over the last few weeks, the Senate has been engaged in the important work of evaluating and confirming President Trump’s cabinet and executive appointees.  As chairman of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, I led the confirmation hearing for CIA Director Mike Pompeo, a key member of the national security team. As a member of the Senate Finance and Health, Education, Pensions, and Labor Committees, I participated in hearings for Education Secretary nominee Betsy DeVos, Health and Human Services nominee Tom Price, and Treasury Secretary nominee Steven Mnuchin.  So far, the Senate has voted to confirm several nominees, including CIA Director Mike Pompeo, United Nations Ambassador Nikki Haley, Defense Secretary General James Mattis, and Secretary of Homeland Security General John Kelly.  In 2009, the Senate held confirmation votes on seven of President Obama’s nominees on inauguration day. The Senate confirmed five more of President Obama’s nominees by the end of his first week in office.  President Trump has selected an excellent team. I am looking forward to continuing the confirmation process in the coming weeks so that the President’s nominees can get to work on behalf of the American people.

Education Secretary nominee Betsy DeVos is a philanthropist who has dedicated her life to improving opportunity for others and is committed to helping all of our nation’s children reach their full potential. She deserves and up or down vote in the Senate.

Elaine Chao is an experienced public servant and I am delighted that Congress will have the opportunity to work with her again as she leads the Department of Transportation. She has the drive and the determination to usher in a new era of infrastructure renewal.

I applaud President Trump’s selection of Judge Neil Gorsuch to serve on the Supreme Court. In 2006, the Senate confirmed him without opposition to serve on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the 10th Circuit. Gorsuch is a judge who will continue to operate in accordance with the rule of law and respect for the Constitution. Senate Minority Leader Senator Chuck Schumer has repeatedly expressed his desire to have nine Justices serving on the Supreme Court. Now that the American people have spoken, and the President has nominated a mainstream jurist, I am hopeful that the Senate will come together and swiftly confirm Judge Gorsuch.  #SCOTUS

Even though the Democrats are throwing everything but the kitchen sink at President Trump’s nominees, Mnuchin proceeds today to a full Senate vote on his confirmation. Mnuchin’s credentials are self-evident proof that he is more than qualified to lead the Department of Treasury. It’s time for the Democrats to stop their shameless grandstanding and let’s get leaders for our government in place quickly, as has been the practice with every President to date.

I know that Rep. Tom Price is well prepared to lead this important agency at this critical time for our nation’s health care system. I was pleased to vote at Committee today, and look forward to a full Senate vote for him to lead HHS. Senate Democrats should stop running side shows and honor the results of the 2016 election so that the President can move forward with putting his leadership in place at these federal agencies.

I’m glad the Senate was able to come together and confirm Rex Tillerson to serve as Secretary of State. As our nation's top diplomat, the Secretary of State will be in charge of leading U.S. diplomatic efforts around the world. At this critical time, I am confident Rex Tillerson has the experience to rise to the challenge.
I’ll be rooting for this puppy named Burr in the #PuppyBowl. Not a member of my family, but looks like a very good dog.

Betsy DeVos has dedicated her life to improving education, so I am glad she will continue to fight for all children as Secretary of Education. Attempts by Senate Democrats to stall the President’s nominees only distract from the very real struggles of North Carolina’s families seeking the best education for their children.

Senator Jeff Sessions has been a friend and a colleague for many years, and during the Judiciary Committee hearings the American people had the opportunity to hear from a variety of individuals about his commitment to the rule of law and record of pursuing justice.  I am pleased that the Senate has confirmed him as Attorney General, and I look forward to continuing the confirmation process so that the President’s team can get to work on behalf of the American people.

Now is a critical time for health care in this country and the American people want us to get it right. As a physician, Health and Human Services Secretary Tom Price has a deep understanding of families’ health care needs and will be an especially valuable member of the President’s team as Congress works to repeal and replace Obamacare.
Thank you Jerry Ensminger for all you have done to fight for Camp Lejeune veterans.

As a member of the Finance committee, I had the opportunity to question Steve Mnuchin at his confirmation hearing and I am confident in his qualifications. I am also pleased that he has committed to cleaning up abuses at the IRS. Americans have been struggling under a stagnant economy for too long. The Treasury Secretary is an essential member of the President’s economic team and I look forward to working with him to get our economy back on track.

I look forward to working with Dr. Shulkin to ensure our veterans receive the world-class health care that they were promised and have earned. This includes making sure that the Veterans Choice Program is not only improved but is also made permanent so that our veterans never have to wait for health care. Additionally, I hope that Dr. Shulkin embraces the accountability authority that Congress has provided the Secretary of Veterans Affairs in order to ensure that all VA employees are working for our nation’s veterans.

Linda McMahon was born in North Carolina and worked for decades to grow a small business into a thriving entertainment enterprise; she exemplifies the American dream. Her real world experience will be incredibly valuable as she serves our nation by leading the Small Business Administration. The fact that Senate Democrats have allowed a swift vote on this qualified nominee is encouraging, I am hopeful we can continue this type of bipartisan cooperation on the rest of the President’s executive nominees.
NA
The media often focuses on partisanship, but in reality there is a lot of bipartisan cooperation in the Senate.The ABLE Act is an example of what we can do when the cause is right.
NA

Wilbur Ross will put his business experience to good use as Secretary of Commerce. I’m glad he has decided to serve our nation and I look forward to working with him on policies that will create jobs for the American people.

In his first few days in office, President Trump was quick to begin honoring his promises to the American people. Going forward, the President tonight outlined a blue print to improve our economy and keep our country safe. Americans were clear about their priorities in this past election and it’s time to work together on issues that are critical to the American people.   For far too long, many have felt forgotten by our government. I am encouraged that Congress can work together with the President to pass legislation that will get our country back on track with a stronger economy for all Americans. It is clear that our citizens want to reel in government spending, create jobs, fix our healthcare system, and strengthen our borders. The President, in keeping his promises, has made significant gains in reinforcing these critical policy areas.    I look forward to working with the President to solve the real, everyday problems that face the American people, and I ask my Senate colleagues to work with him to achieve these goals.

I’m proud to support Ryan Zinke. He is an excellent choice to lead the Department of Interior. Zinke is a champion of conservation, and I look forward to working with him to ensure that the Land and Water Conservation Fund program will continue to preserve North Carolina’s natural treasures for future generations.

I have no doubts about Dr. Carson’s commitment to serving this nation. Dr. Carson will look at housing policy with fresh eyes and move forward with programs that will help communities thrive so that all Americans can reach their full potential.

It is absolutely unacceptable that the scheduling system does not provide accurate information about wait times. A significant percentage of veterans are still waiting more than 30 days for necessary health care appointments. Furthermore, the VA has failed to identify and assist 90 percent of the veterans who, due to wait times, are eligible to use the Choice program to receive care outside of the VA system. This shameful incompetence caused some veterans to wait more than 80 days for an appointment. I expect Secretary Shulkin to use the power that Congress has given him to hold employees accountable and get the results that our veterans demand.

The House plan is a good first step toward providing relief from the broken promises, costly mandates, and government bureaucracy created by Obamacare. I look forward to working with my colleagues to fulfill our promise to the American people to repeal and replace Obamacare with solutions that make health insurance more affordable and that give families more control over their own health care.

I’m pleased the Committee was able to report out our former colleague Dan Coats and I look forward to supporting his nomination on the Senate floor. I am confident Dan will be an excellent Director of National Intelligence and know that he will draw on his deep knowledge of intelligence issues to help the Intelligence Community address the wide range of challenges to our national security.
Proud to have two North Carolina teams competing in the ACC semifinals tonight  #ACCTourney Duke Men's Basketball The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

I'm working with Senator Thom Tillis and Congressman Robert Pittenger to improve weather radar coverage for the Charlotte area. We have made a lot of progress on this issue, but the weather radar covering the Charlotte area is still dangerously deficient. I’m hopeful we can pass this legislation again in the Senate and I look forward to working with Congressman Robert Pittenger to get it passed in the House.
Happy K9 Veterans Day to our heroes with four legs #MilitaryMonday
The Senate is in session on this snowy day ❄❄

The Department of Veterans Affairs policy granting disability compensation to veterans suffering from illnesses caused by contaminated water at Camp Lejeune went into effect today.  It has been a long fight for these veterans to get the compensation they deserve. I want to thank Jerry Ensminger for his work on behalf of the Lejeune veterans and their families. These men and women sacrificed for our nation and have earned this care and support. I encourage all veterans who may be eligible for compensation to contact my office for assistance making a claim.

Today, the Senate voted to confirm our colleague Dan Coats to become the Director of National Intelligence. Dan has the experience and judgment necessary to effectively lead the Intelligence Community.  He understands well the unique nature of intelligence work and will ensure the IC has the legal tools and authorities needed to help keep our country safe.

Last week, members of the Senate Intelligence Committee joined me on a fact finding trip to the Middle East. While in Lebanon, we took a moment to visit the memorial for the Americans killed in the 1983 Beirut barracks bombing and remembered their sacrifices.
NA

My thoughts and prayers go out to all those affected by the senseless acts of violence in London.  I will continue to track the events closely and to ensure that our Intelligence Community is providing all requested support to our friends in the United Kingdom.  Together we must continue to face down terrorism and track down those who inspire these brutal attacks.
Proud to work on bipartisan policies that give students and families better options to save for higher education.

My joint statement with Vice Chairman Senator Mark Warner on Jared Kushner’s voluntary participation in the Senate Intelligence Committee investigation:   "From the beginning of this investigation we have committed to follow the facts wherever they lead us. This announcement serves to demonstrate that commitment.  Mr. Kushner will certainly not be the last person the committee calls to give testimony, but we expect him to be able to provide answers to key questions that have arisen in our inquiry. The timing of Mr. Kushner’s testimony is still being determined, but will only come after the committee determines that it has received any documents or information necessary to ensure that the meeting is productive for all sides."
Winner on and off the court.

This morning, I introduced the Janey Ensminger Act with Sen. Bill Nelson, Senator Marco Rubio, and Senator Thom Tillis so Camp Lejeune veterans can get the care they need.   The Veterans Administration continues to deny clear scientific links between debilitating diseases and exposure to certain toxic chemicals in the drinking water at Camp Lejeune. The Janey Ensminger Act requires the VA to do the right thing and give veterans the medical care they need. The military negligently poisoned these service members and they shouldn’t have to fight the VA every time that government researchers find a link between a disease and the toxins that were in their drinking water.
NA

This is a step in the right direction. When it comes to dangerous tornadoes, accurate weather forecasting is critical to ensuring the safety of citizens. This legislation instructs the National Weather Service to identify solutions for improving inadequate weather radar covering the Charlotte area and other parts of the country. I’m glad my colleagues recognize the importance of providing the tools that cities like Charlotte need to prepare for potential disasters.

Today, I led an open Senate Intelligence Committee hearing titled “Disinformation: A Primer in Russian Active Measures and Influence Campaigns,” where we heard from experts about the methods the Russians may have used to attempt to influence the 2016 election. Here are some highlights from the hearing.
NA
Today we honor the families of service members who gave their lives for our country. #GoldStarWivesDay
Thank you National Down Syndrome Society for the Champion of Change award. Proud to continue our work helping people with Down syndrome reach their full potential. #ABLE

The United States has always been a global leader in fighting genocide. This week, Bashar al-Assad once again committed genocide against the Syrian people with the one of the most horrific weapons known to man. I am encouraged that the President decided to take action. The United States is once again asserting its leadership responsibility in eliminating genocide.

Neil Gorsuch is a trusted mainstream jurist who is ready to shoulder the incredible responsibility of serving on the Supreme Court. Justice Gorsuch will serve the American people well as a defender of the Constitution. I congratulate Justice Gorsuch on his confirmation, and I thank him for answering the call to serve this great nation.

The Land and Water Conservation Fund has a proven track record of making good on the promise of conserving our parks, open spaces, and wildlife habitats for the benefit of future generations of Americans. My colleagues and I offered this bill to permanently extend the LWCF, a program that preserves our natural heritage but does so without asking American taxpayers to shoulder the burden. I look forward to my colleagues coming together to pass this bipartisan legislation.
NA
Stopped by Fort Bragg this morning. Thank you to the men and women who sacrifice to keep our nation safe.
The doctors who work at UNC Health and UNC Horizons programs are on the front line in the battle against opioid addiction.
Wonderful to visit with NC seniors at Wakefield Spring in Raleigh this week.
Had the opportunity to participate in a dedication ceremony for the new senior center in Reidsville today.
This is a step in the right direction. When it comes to dangerous tornadoes, accurate weather forecasting is critical to ensuring the safety of citizens.

I’m pleased the Senate confirmed Sonny Perdue to lead the Department of Agriculture. Agriculture is a vital part of North Carolina’s economy, and I know Secretary Perdue will work to promote policies that help our farmers and rural communities thrive.

Tomorrow, the Senate Intelligence Committee is holding an open hearing on the nomination of Courtney Simmons Elwood to be General Counsel of the Central Intelligence Agency. Tune on the Intelligence Committee website at 10am.  https://www.intelligence.senate.gov/hearings/open-hearing-nomination-courtney-simmons-elwood-be-general-counsel-central-intelligence
Last night, the Senate passed a resolution recognizing the The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill men's basketball team. Congrats on six national championships!

I'm pleased the Senate Health Committee has advanced this legislation, especially with warmer weather on the way, and the mosquitos that come with it. The SMASH Act will give communities the support they need to fight the mosquitos that spread the Zika virus. This bill will help fund programs that are critical for identifying, controlling, and reducing mosquitos that spread infectious diseases.
Sharing a little US history with students from Butner-Stem Elementary.
Thank you Senator Luther Strange for cosponsoring my motor sports protection bill. The EPA should leave race car enthusiasts alone.
NA

Today, I reintroduced legislation to grant federal recognition to the Lumbee so that the 55,000 members of the Lumbee community in North Carolina receive the same rights and benefits as members of other federally recognized tribes. The Lumbee tribe has been seeking recognition for more than a century. This is long overdue. I want to thank Congressman Robert Pittenger for working with me to advance this important cause.  Last year, Lumbee Chairman Harvey Godwin Jr. testified before the Senate Committee on Indian Affairs about the importance of federal recognition.

Veteran homelessness is a heartbreaking issue. We are making progress in combating veterans’ homelessness, and over the last 2 years, we have seen the number of homeless veterans decrease to around 40,000, but that is still far too many, and I will continue to address this problem until the number is zero. In particular, many women have been unable to fully participate in existing programs because their children were not allowed to live in the transitional housing. The Homeless Veterans Prevention Act bill addresses this shortcoming and increases the availability of housing for homeless veterans.

I am troubled by the timing and reasoning of Director Comey’s termination. I have found Director Comey to be a public servant of the highest order, and his dismissal further confuses an already difficult investigation by the Committee. In my interactions with the Director and with the Bureau under his leadership, he and the FBI have always been straightforward with our Committee.  Director Comey has been more forthcoming with information than any FBI Director I can recall in my tenure on the congressional intelligence committees. His dismissal, I believe, is a loss for the Bureau and the nation.
Acting FBI Director Andrew McCabe will testify before an open hearing of the Senate Intelligence Committee tomorrow.

The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence today issued a subpoena for former National Security Advisor Lieutenant General Michael Flynn. The subpoena requests documents relevant to the Committee’s investigation into Russian interference with the 2016 election.  The Committee first requested these documents in an April 28, 2017 letter to Lieutenant General Flynn, but he declined, through counsel, to cooperate with the Committee’s request.

Intelligence community leaders including the acting FBI Director and Directors of the CIA and NSA testify before an open hearing of Senate Select Committee on Intelligence this morning. WATCH LIVE at 10am.
Thanks for stopping by our DC office Victory Christian Center School. 1 of 6 NC teams competing in the 2017 Team America Rocketry Challenge National Finals!
Wonderful to participate in a manufacturing education event at a North Carolina bus company in Archdale today.

Last week, I introduced the National Nurse Act of 2017. Every day, nurses provide quality care for Americans who are in need. Nurses provide critical lifesaving care and are supported by resources in the Title VIII nursing programs. I am proud to work with my colleagues to reauthorize the important Title VIII nursing programs. Our legislation will ensure that our nation’s nursing workforce is ready to meet the needs of patients in North Carolina and across the country.
This afternoon, Intel Vice Chair Senator Mark Warner and I took a moment to speak to the press about our ongoing investigation into Russian activity and the 2016 election.
Thankful to learn that Senator Thom Tillis is feeling better.

Today, the Senate Intelligence Committee sent two additional letters seeking information related to the Committee’s ongoing investigation.  The first was sent to former FBI Director James Comey seeking his appearance before the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence in both open and closed sessions. The second was sent to Acting FBI Director Andrew McCabe, seeking any notes or memorandum prepared by the former Director regarding any communications he may have had with senior White House and Department of Justice officials related to investigations into Russia’s efforts.
7th graders from Wilmington checking out one of the Capitol’s historic attractions. Thanks for stopping by! #LongLiveTheThing

The appointment of former FBI Director and respected lawyer Robert Mueller as special counsel for the Russia investigation is a positive development and will provide some certainty for the American people that the investigation will proceed fairly and free of political influence.   The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence will continue its own investigation and to the extent any deconfliction is required, we will engage with Director Mueller and our expectation is that he will engage with the Committee as well.

The current student loan repayment programs are too complicated and too expensive. The Repay Act has two very simple goals: first, give students straightforward options on how to repay their student loan debt; and second, limit the excessive taxpayer-funded subsides that are incentivizing families and students to borrow too much. We have made a lot of progress in reducing student loan interest rates. The Repay Act is an important next step toward improving higher education financing options for students and families.

Former FBI Director James Comey has committed to testify in open session before the Senate Intelligence Committee. The Committee will schedule the open hearing after Memorial Day.   The Committee looks forward to receiving testimony from the former Director on his role in the development of the Intelligence Community Assessment on Russian interference in the 2016 US elections, and I am hopeful that he will clarify for the American people recent events that have been broadly reported in the media.

While we recognize General Flynn’s constitutional right to invoke the Fifth Amendment, we are disappointed he has chosen to disregard the Committee’s subpoena request for documents relevant and necessary to our investigation.  We will vigorously pursue General Flynn’s testimony and his production of any and all pertinent materials pursuant to the Committee’s authorities.
NA
My prayers are with the victims of the horrific attack in #Manchester.
NC Air Guard keeps me on time and safe. Thanks guys.
I wear this every day to remind me of the bravest Americans who have sacrificed for our great country. Thank you always. #MemorialDay
Former FBI Director Comey will testify before the Senate Intelligence Committee next week.
A rare sighting of me with socks. #SockFactory #MadeInNC
Former FBI Director Comey will testify before the Senate Intelligence Committee tomorrow.
Attorney General Jeff Sessions will testify before an open hearing of the Senate Intelligence Committee tomorrow afternoon.
Praying for the shooting victims. Thankful for the men & women of law enforcement who put their lives on the line to keep everyone safe.

I'm glad the Senate voted to confirm North Carolina native Brock Long to lead FEMA. Having strong disaster preparedness and recovery infrastructure is critically important for North Carolina. Brock Long understands that it is the work done before a storm that saves lives. Helping states and cities establish emergency management plans allows funding and assistance to flow almost immediately after the storm has passed. Brock will put his wealth of experience to good use at FEMA.

The draft health care legislation released today outlines a number of initiatives that are good for North Carolina. While not perfect, the bill does provide the funding we need to support our most vulnerable North Carolinians. I’m encouraged that it keeps the law protecting people with pre-existing conditions. The legislation also reverses $31 billion in cuts made to Medicaid by Obamacare, extends millions of dollars in funding to our Community Health Centers, and provides $2 billion to the fight against the opioid epidemic.

I'm chairing today's open hearing "Russian Intervention in European Elections" right now. You can watch it live at home here: https://www.intelligence.senate.gov/hearings/open-hearing-russian-intervention-european-elections

My prayers are with the families of the fifteen Marines and one Navy corpsman who lost their lives in yesterday’s accident in Mississippi. Sadly, we fear that seven of these individuals hailed from Camp Lejeune. Every day, our bravest men and women put their lives on the line to ensure our freedoms. I’m heartbroken that this tragic event has happened.
Had a little fun a few week ago behind the scenes of DHS official David Glawe's confirmation hearing with his sweet children.
Looking forward to moving a few more confirmation hearings through the Senate Intelligence Committee this week.
Glad to hear Senator John McCain is doing well after his surgery. I'm looking forward to having the Maverick back in the Senate soon.
I commend The U.S. Department of the Treasury for continuing to hold Iran accountable targeting those involved in heinous terrorist activities.
This morning we have several confirmations for key intelligence posts in Senate Intel. Watch the hearing live here:
I'm praying for my very good friend but let's remember: No one is tougher than John McCain.

I was glad to lead the hearing for another key intelligence community nominee last week. Susan Gordon, who will be the Principal Deputy Director of National Intelligence, is just one of the many vital intelligence officials the Senate needs to approve to keep this country safe. It’s time to quit slow-walking the folks who do some of the country’s most important national security work.

Today, the Senate began the process of keeping true to its word and fixing the crumbling insurance system in our country. Make no mistake – Under Obamacare, premiums have skyrocketed over 170% in our state alone. I refuse to stand by while North Carolinians continue to lose coverage, choice, and their hard-earned money, and that is why I voted in favor of the Motion to Proceed this afternoon. We need solutions, and I’m encouraged by the Senate’s progress to begin its very important work discussing and finding a replacement.

The rampant abuse at the IRS has continued and thrived for far too long. Whether it is the rehiring of previously terminated employees or continuing to give bonuses to poorly performing executives who can’t be fired – the delinquency at the IRS must end. It’s exactly actions like this that erode the public’s trust in their government. The time to put a stop to these atrocious practices is now.
I'm disappointed. My statement is below:

The American people are sick and tired of Washington at its worst. We have Americans paying the salaries of IRS workers who have repeatedly cheated the very government they took an oath to serve, and a Commissioner who won’t hold them accountable. I’ve had enough, and I know you have too. That’s why I’ve introduced the Ensuring Integrity in the IRS Workforce Act of 2017. The rampant abuse at the IRS has continued and thrived for far too long, and the time to put a stop to these atrocious practices is now.
If it’s August, you know it’s time to lace up the cleats, don the shoulder pads, and strap up the helmet. It’s football season, and I’ll always miss the early morning smell of fresh grass in August.
Keep on swimming, Hilton...
I will keep working with Sen. Tillis to get the Salisbury VA working like it should. There are still important improvements to be made. Read about the last watchdog report on the facility below:

Excited to see so many colleges and universities from North Carolina garnering national praise. No fewer than 10 institutions were named to The Princeton Review’s Best 382 Colleges: 2018 Edition. Keep up the good work!
Happy 227th Birthday to the U.S. Coast Guard! Thank you for all you do and for keeping our country safe.
North Carolina boasts the tallest lighthouse in the United States with the Cape Hatteras Lighthouse checking at 208 feet. Happy National Lighthouse Day!
I'm pleased to see the U.N. Security Council firmly sanction North Korea. This rogue regime cannot continue to threaten with impunity.
Great tour of an important manufacturing facility in North Wilkesboro. Good to see NC manufacturing continuing to thrive.
I spoke with WXII NBC Greensboro yesterday about recent provocations with North Korea. Here's what I had to say:
Thank you for having me!

It was an honor to finally present Sergeant Ronnie Whitlow with the medals he earned serving his country so many years ago in Vietnam. As an Army Officer, Sgt. Whitlow earned the Bronze Star, the Purple Heart, the Air Medal, the National Defense Service Medal, the Vietnam Service Medal, and numerous other distinctions. On behalf of all North Carolinians, thank you for your service.

As I've told multiple stations in North Carolina yesterday and today: I'm terribly saddened by Saturday's events in Charlottesville, Virginia. Violence has no place in our society and we must come together as a country to condemn these acts.
I feel the same today as I did yesterday when I spoke with WXII:
North Carolina thanks Sergeant Ronnie Whitlow for his service to our country.
My statement on the terror attacks in Spain:
Great stopping by a fueling equipment manufacturer in Clayton, NC earlier this week. The products made here are used all over the world!
Appreciated the opportunity to speak to several Rotary Clubs throughout the state last week. Thanks for having me!

Keeping Texas in my prayers today for everyone in the path of Hurricane Harvey. Please listen to local authorities and stay safe.

62 years ago today, Emmett Till was the victim of a brutal racist act that claimed his life. Emmett was not the only victim of racially charged crimes during the Civil Rights era. In 2008, the Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Act was signed into law. This bill created a program to investigate and prosecute civil rights crimes during that era, mostly against African-Americans, that went unsolved with the perpetrators never held accountable. Last year, President Obama signed into law a permanent reauthorization of this program in order to pursue justice for the victims and families affected by those heinous acts.  I’m thankful for the opportunity to have joined with so many colleagues here in Congress in working to enact this law as a part of Emmett Till's legacy.
Always appreciate being able to tour North Carolina's hard-working manufacturing plants. I was in West Jefferson recently to tour a state of the art facility.
I couldn't be more proud to see the brave men and women of North Carolina's Camp Lejeune prepared to help those in Hurricane Harvey's wake.

It was great stopping by Wingate University Hendersonville Health Sciences Center recently for an in-depth tour of all the incredible programs they have to offer. Thanks so much for having me.

There’s much to be done when Congress returns this week. I’m eager to get to work for the people of North Carolina and America as we tackle the difficult issues voters sent us to Washington to address.

In today's Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee hearing, the experts on the ground agreed that states - not the federal government - need more control over their own health care markets to deliver better services to individuals.

While Florida will be most heavily affected by Irma, other states, including North Carolina will eventually feel its power. I cannot urge you strongly enough to heed the instructions of local law enforcement and safety officials. If you are in remote areas, please seek appropriate shelter. Have a safety plan, and remain vigilant. The North Carolina Department of Public Safety – Emergency Management Division is hard at work preparing for potential effects. Please follow them at their Twitter (https://twitter.com/ncemergency) and Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/NCEmergency/) pages for up-to-date information, as well as ReadyNC.org. Rest assured, Congress also remains ready and willing to respond to whatever challenges nature presents us.
I'm continuing to work to get the IRS cleaned up, I'll do whatever it takes to bring integrity back to our government.

My statement today on the Senate’s passage of the National Defense Authorization Act. We’ve made important progress on rebuilding our military and keeping our country safe.

I'm travelling across North Carolina to meet with constituents and visit vital emergency operations centers, and next week I’ll be back in Washington working to bring these same folks the tax relief they need. By simplifying and lowering the tax code, bringing overseas money home, and putting money back in the pockets of hardworking Americans, we can truly unleash the economy and get our country moving again.

I met some fantastic young folks in Elizabeth City yesterday when I had the opportunity to stop by the Northeast Academy for Aerospace and Advanced Technologies and the RiverCity YouthBuild. They are doing some amazing work there!   Next, I met with Elizabeth City Mayor Joe Peele and the Elizabeth City Rotary Club to talk about important issues facing North Carolina and the nation. Finally, I visited the future site of the Perquimans Marine Industrial Park. It's been a busy week, but it's always good to be home in North Carolina.

Happy 242nd birthday to the brave men and women of the U.S. Navy. These amazing sailors have been keeping our country safe since 1775. I cannot thank them and the rest of our armed forces enough for their incredible sacrifices. #242NavyBday

Tomorrow, the Senate Intelligence Committee will hold an open hearing on the nomination of Christopher Sharpley to be the Inspector General of the Central Intelligence Agency. If you want to follow along live, you can watch through the link below tomorrow at 2:30pm.

Today’s announced premium increases make it clear, yet again, that Obamacare isn’t working. Our state has seen double digit premium increases each year since the enactment of this law, and I remain committed to providing North Carolinians with solutions designed to decrease premiums and increase plan choices.

Early yesterday morning, over a hundred families were reunited in North Carolina. I'm so proud of these young men and women and I couldn't be happier to have so many of them home safe and sound. I think I speak for the rest of North Carolina and the country as I thank them for their service.

It was great to have Lieutenant General Stephen Townsend in my office this week. As the Commanding General of the Combined Joint Task Force - Operation Inherent Resolve for US Central Command, the XVIII Airborne Corps, and Fort Bragg, Lt. Gen. Townsend has a lot on his plate. We discussed his recent deployment and readiness issues for the brave men and women stationed at Fort Bragg. North Carolinians and Americans everywhere are lucky to have someone like him serving our nation.

Below is my weekly update on my work in Washington. Next week, we'll be full steam ahead. You can follow along for hearings and press releases at www.Burr.Senate.Gov, at Twitter @SenatorBurr, and here on Facebook.

Senator Thom Tillis and I had a great meeting with the Mayor of Cornelius, Chuck Travis, and his wife, Janice, last week. I always enjoy an opportunity to meet with North Carolina's local leaders - Come back soon, Chuck!

Tomorrow morning, Senator Mark Warner and I will lead the Senate Intelligence Committee in an open hearing with testimony from a number of social media companies. We are continuing our investigation into Russia's meddling in the 2016 elections, and I look forward to hearing more about these companies' efforts to root out foreign attempts to interefere in our democratic process. You can watch the hearing live here on C-SPAN:

The Senate Intelligence Committee heard from Facebook, Twitter, and Google today on Russia's efforts to meddle in our 2016 elections. Nearly one year later,  I still don't feel these companies have a complete understanding of the full scope of Russian interference.These platforms have tremendous reach and their actions have to catch up with their responsibilities - quickly. As I said today, there is no doubt that Russia reached out and attempted to sow discord in our democratic process. As our committee continues our investigation, I look forward to hearing more about the companies' efforts to thwart such efforts in the future.

After yesterday's hearing, I sat down with Samantha-Jo Roth from Spectrum News North Carolina to discuss Russia's intereference in our election, the progress of the investigation and the social media companies' role going forward.

This week, several social media companies testified before the Senate Intelligence Committee. Read more about my thoughts on the hearing and the investigation moving forward in my weekly newsletter below:

The rain kept us inside, but it was still great catching up with Seniors from Research Triangle High School in front of the full-scale model of the Statue of Freedom that sits atop the Capitol Dome. Thanks for visiting, hope y'all stayed dry!

This week, the Senate Finance Committee is busy working on #TaxReform that would create nearly 1 MILLION new jobs and save families close to $2 TRILLION.

I spoke about my bill, the Recognizing the Protection of Motorsports (RPM) Act of 2017 before today's hearing in the Environment and Public Works Subcommittee on Clean Air and Nuclear Safety. Congress never intended for race cars to be treated the same as passenger vehicles, and this bill helps clarify that intent. My opening statement is below along with more information about the hearing at the link:  https://www.epw.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/hearings?ID=03FBE169-C399-40EB-AF89-C3C5FADBD524

In today's Rocky Mount Telegram: State to Study Efforts to Reduce Flooding:  “Mitigation efforts will make it easier, faster and cheaper for North Carolina to bounce back from weather-related events, especially in vulnerable areas like these four river basins. I’m pleased with this progress and look forward to working with state and local entities to begin these efforts.”

I spoke this afternoon on the importance of #TaxReform and the #TaxCutsandJobsAct. We're here to unleash the economy and get out of the way of individuals and small businesses trying to make a way for themselves.
We made great progress last night as the Senate Finance Committee approved the #TaxCutsandJobsAct. My statement on this positive step forward is below:

Today, let’s give thanks for our nation's military members and families.  We have so much to be thankful for, and while most of us will spend today with loved ones, our bravest men and women are often spread out across the world, away from their families, defending our country.  Thank you to the men and women serving in the military, especially if you are far from home, and Happy Thanksgiving.

via The Wall Street Journal, some of the smartest economists in the country, including a former Treasury Secretary and several former Chairmen of the Council of Economic Advisers, agree that this tax bill is pro-growth and helps reduce taxes on hard-working folks across the country. #TaxCutsandJobsAct #TaxReform
North Carolina tops Forbes' Best States for Business list for 2017, and makes the Top 5 for the 12th straight year! Couldn't be prouder to call North Carolina home.
Retailers and Manufacturers agree, tax reform will raise wages and get our economy moving. We're on the cusp of a historic opportunity to fix our broken tax code, we can't let it go to waste.

By lowering the corporate tax rate, billions of dollars will find their way back to American factories and infrastructure improvements, and that means more jobs and better wages. The benefits are clear, passing the #TaxCutsandJobsAct is a must.
NA

Today we remember those lost on the “date which will live in infamy.” When the U.S. Naval Base at Pearl Harbor was attacked 76 years ago, more than 2,400 brave sailors lost their lives. We do our best to honor their heroism and sacrifice for our country on this #PearlHarborRemembranceDay.

It's an honor to have the U.S. Army decide to train the 2nd of 6 new Security Force Assistance Brigades at Fort Bragg, N.C. Some of the best and bravest serve our country there, and we're proud they call North Carolina home.

I was very pleased today to have the National Defense Authorization Act signed into law. This bill gives our troops a long overdue 2.4 percent pay raise and includes $293 million for military construction across North Carolina at Camp Lejeune, Cherry Point, and Seymour Johnson Air Force Base. It also begins the process of improving collaboration between the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) and the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.

I sat down in North Carolina last week to talk about the #TaxReform currently under consideration. We have a historic opportunity in front of us, and we can't let it go to waste. We want people to invest in the future.

I released the following statement regarding the President's speech today on a new National Security Strategy to help promote American security and safety:  "Today, President Trump spoke to the threats facing the United States, including a growing extremist threat and ongoing competition from Russia and China.  The threats against our country and our citizens include not only acts of violence but also insidious cyber-attacks that undermine our democracy and ongoing economic espionage that damages our economy.  The President today committed to maintaining America as the world’s only superpower and reassured our allies that the previous administration’s ‘lead from behind’ era of American leadership is over."

From my family to yours, we want to wish everyone a very Merry Christmas! I hope you all have an opportunity to spend the holidays with family, friends, children and grandchildren. And for those who are serving and protecting the United States far away from home, we're thinking about you and praying for you. Thank you for your service, and Happy Holidays.
NA
